data.title: Editor can loose focus when clicking into certain part of the word
data.body:
**Channel**: insiders 1.10.0 (does not reproduce in stable)
**OS**: macOS
**Zoom**: `window.zoomLevel: 1`

Noticed this in insiders that I often end up with the editor having no focus when I click into a word.

I can easily reproduce by trying to double click into certain characters and at some point, focus is lost:

![kapture 2017-02-06 at 8 34 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/22638233/1222fbf4-ec47-11e6-9c60-538cdd5f08d9.gif)

You will also notice that when I start to select over a word, at specific characters the selection jumps to the end of the line and is flashing quite hectic.

data.title: Implement reference streaming from language server to UI
data.body:
***edited 2017-02-16*** 

This is a proposal to allow language servers to stream the response to "Find all references" requests. This is beneficial because it may take a while for the language server to find all results for large repos and the user can benefit from seeing results as they are found.

Implementing this will require changes at multiple layers.
- vscode (PR https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/20346)
- vscode-languageclient ([discussion](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/161), PR https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/pull/164)
- LSP protocol ([discussion](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/issues/141), PR https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/pull/182)
    - Sourcegraph Go language server [has implemented experimental support](https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/sourcegraph/go-langserver/-/blob/langserver/references.go#L36:5-36:21)

data.title: how to support object rest spread
data.body:
- VSCode Version: the latest
- OS Version: win10

```javascript
{
  a: 3,
  b: 4,
  ...{c: 5}
}
```

it is call [object rest spreading](https://babeljs.io/docs/plugins/transform-object-rest-spread/).
how could i make vscode to support this syntax?

data.title: Suggestion - Add a line-spacing or line-margin option

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
i create a new post because i didn't see anything that exactly correspond to my demand in already existing tickets.

What i suggest is to add a line-spacing flag in the editor category, that should add a space, who is 0px by default BETWEEN lines.

It is different from lineHeight flag because line height also modify the size of the carret, line hightlight, etc...

it seems to be very capricious suggestion, and i don't know if it is possible in the actual software architecture, but i let it here, in case of. I used to use this in sublime text before, and it greatly helped me to read the code easier.

An alternative could be to change carret and line-highlight to always scales to the font size instead of line-height size.

Due to my frenshyness, please, excuse me for my approximative english.
I hope this is understandable. Do not hesitate to question me otherwise.

thanks
Guema

VSCode insert spaces after opening and before closing curly braces in javascript, Is there support remove those spaces?

data.title: Cannot find runtime 'node' on PATH
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.2.0|

---

**To reproduce:**
<hr />

- Use my computer to open VSCode
- Create a `console.log('Hello, World!');` JavaScript file
- Launch as node application from the VSCode Debugger view

Produces error: `Cannot find runtime 'node' on PATH`

**Given:**
<hr />

- My launch.json:

<!-- language: lang-json -->

    {
    	"version": "0.2.0",
    	"configurations": [
    		{
    			"type": "node",
    			"request": "launch",
    			"name": "Build",
    			"program": "${workspaceRoot}/build.js",
    			"cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
    		}
    	]
    }

- I have moved nodejs to within 2048 characters of my PATH variable.
- I have restarted my computer.
- I have restarted VSCode.
- `node -v` gives `v6.9.5`

*From both CMD and the Integrated Terminal (tried both sysnative/cmd and PowerShell):*

- `PATH` contains `D:/Program Files/nodejs`
- `where node` returns `D:/Program Files/nodejs/node.exe`

*From the Google Developer Console:*

- `process.env.PATH` contains `D:/Program Files/nodejs`
- Running the following code produces `D:/Program Files/nodejs/node.exe`:

<!-- language: lang-js -->

    (function(){
        const cp = require('child_process');
        const env = Object.assign({}, process.env, {
            ATOM_SHELL_INTERNAL_RUN_AS_NODE: '1',
            ELECTRON_NO_ATTACH_CONSOLE: '1'
        });
        const result = cp.spawnSync('where', ['node'], {
            detached: true,
            stdio: ['ignore', 'pipe', process.stderr],
            env,
            encoding: 'utf8'
        });
        
        console.log(result.stdout);
    })();

**Additional (Maybe Related)**
<hr />

- Also .NET-Core applications behave identically - terminal and cmd works, `dotnet` is on the path, but Launch from VSCode debugger view fails to find CLI Tools on the path.

- Attaching to an existing `dotnet` process produces a different error:
`Please set up the launch configuration file for your application. command 'csharp.listProcess' not found`

**Update**

I've been doing some debugging, and it looks like the following code produces `Command Failed: echo test`:

<!-- language: lang-js -->

    require('child_process')
    .execSync('echo test', {cwd: workspaceRoot, env: process.env});

Under the hood, it winds up calling

<!-- language: lang-js -->

    require('child_process')
    .spawnSync('cmd', ['/s', '/c', '"echo test"'], {cwd: workspaceRoot, env: process.env});

The command it builds under the hood is `C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /s /c "echo test"` which I tested *outside* of VSCode, and does indeed print `test`.

Inside VSCode, the `spawnSync` call reveals that the exit code is `3221225477`.

In fact, every time I use `child_process` to execute something via cmd, the exit code is `3221225477`. I can get `spawnSync` to start other processes aside from cmd, though. This works:

<!-- language: lang-js -->

    require('child_process')
    .spawnSync('node', ['build.js'], {cwd: workspaceRoot, env: process.env});

data.title: [json] Configure the severity level of trailing commas

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
VS Code already supports comments in config JSON as per https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1341 which is very useful. It also means that the `.json` files are no longer JSON files, strictly speaking, so while you're at it, it would also be great if I didn't need to juggle the trailing commas all the time. For example, these could be taken as valid "JSONs":

```json
[1, 2,]
```

```json
{
    "key1": 1,
    "key2": true,
}
```

I understand the controversy behind this, just posting this after having spent too much time fixing commas in various config files :)

data.title: Generated tasks.json for TypeScript watch mode contains deprecated isWatching field
data.body:
VS Code 1.9, Windows 10

Generated tasks.json contains deprecated field `isWatching`, should be `isBackground`.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/101152/22630875/fd8ceda2-ec01-11e6-970f-23384562bb35.png)

data.title: Powershell integrated terminal stopped working on macOS after upgrading to 1.9.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:23:30.856Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.3|
|vscode-css-formatter|aeschli|0.0.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|LogFileHighlighter|emilast|1.0.1|
|vscode-npm|fknop|3.3.0|
|rest-client|humao|0.12.1|
|reg|ionutvmi|0.0.1|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.2|
|ftp-sync|lukasz-wronski|0.3.2|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.1.2|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|

---
After upgrading to 1.9.0, when using powershell as the integrated terminal every character type is followed by a number of  "^Q", making it unusable. I also tried to set the terminal back to bash and it works, but when I start a powershell session the same problem occurs.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. run powershell as integrate terminal
2. type anything

![test](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13320961/22630251/c7a0126a-ebf6-11e6-85a8-28368ddc0b31.gif)

data.title: Error pylint is not installed when vscode has installed it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro w/all updates
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Save a python source file
2. Agree to install pylint by clicking the error message
3. Installation procedure says pylint already installed (I did it more than once).
4. Save a python source file - error always reported, even if select disable option.

data.title: Disable hover in editor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a function
2. Reference it somewhere
3. Mouse-Hover the function pops up a little box with informations

Just as described in https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/editingevolved#_hover

Is there a way to disable it or at least set a delay?
I find myself in many situations where this just blocks my view.
